Interface_name: HTTP Server-side based on Tornado in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Tornado-based HTTP server that can handle specific URL routes for string manipulation, including reversing strings and wrapping text to a specified width.

Class Description: TornadoHTTPServer is a class that encapsulates the setup and execution of a Tornado web server with predefined request handlers for string operations.

Attributes:
- app: tornado.web.Application - The Tornado web application instance that manages URL routing and handlers
- http_server: tornado.httpserver.HTTPServer - The HTTP server instance that serves the application
- port: int - The port number on which the server listens (default: 8000)

Methods:
- __init__(port: int = 8000) -> None - Initializes the HTTP server with specified port and sets up URL routing
  - port: int - The port number to bind the server to (default: 8000)
- start() -> None - Starts the HTTP server and begins listening for incoming requests
  - No parameters
  - No return value (runs indefinitely until interrupted)

Additional Handler Classes:
- ReverseHandler: tornado.web.RequestHandler - Handles GET requests for string reversal
  - get(input_word: str) -> None - Reverses the input string and writes it to response
    - input_word: str - The string to be reversed (captured from URL)
- WrapHandler: tornado.web.RequestHandler - Handles POST requests for text wrapping
  - post() -> None - Wraps text to specified width and writes to response
    - Retrieves 'name' (text) and 'width' (optional, default 40) from POST parameters
